title: Companies Finalize $26 Billion Deal With States and Cities to End Opioid Lawsuits - The New York Times
content:
1. Companies Finalize $26 Billion Deal With States and Cities to End Opioid Lawsuits  The New York Times
  2. J&J, distributors finalize $26 billion opioid settlement  Reuters
  3. 4 U.S. companies will pay $26 billion to settle claims they fueled the opioid crisis  NPR
  4. $483 million coming to Kentucky following opioid settlement, AG says  WHAS11
  5. Drug distributors, J&J agree to finalize $26 billion opioid settlement  KSL.com
  6. View Full Coverage on Google News
description: The first checks could be cut in April. The money — from the nation’s three major pharmaceutical distributors and Johnson & Johnson — will be used for addiction treatment and prevention.
